comments:
I believe this is why I am sometimes not seeing terminated launches removed 
even when the pref is set.

The only way this can happen (I think), is when a thread is created, and is 
initially set to "suspended". It then resumes (without telling us), and the 
call to compute stack frames is performed because the thread thinks it is 
suspended - which throws the exception. However, the exception is caught and 
logged, and #hasChildren() returns false (in launch view content provider), so 
I don't think it should effect removing terminated launches.

The exception is no longer logged - the java thread detects the case that it 
has resumed in #hasStackFrames().

Fixed. (cannot duplicate the launch not being removed problem)
